items.name: Pflanzaktion mit ClimatePartner Impact & Life Terra

fields.event-name: Pflanzaktion mit ClimatePartner Impact & Life Terra
fields.event_details:
On a sunny winter day near Berlin, the volunteers from ClimatePartner, their network of clients, and team members from Life Terra met for the first time in person‚Äîout in the field, planting trees together.

ClimatePartner invited several client companies from the region to join the event, giving participants the chance to experience firsthand what it is like to plant young trees, and help restore a healthy forest ecosystem. The fenced planting area receives 6,800 new saplings representing 18 different species‚Äîa highly biodiverse mix designed to improve ecological resilience, support a wide range of fauna, and reduce risks associated with pests, diseases, and climate-related stress.

During this volunteer day, our group focused on planting five deciduous species: hornbeam, large-leaved lime, sweet chestnut, sycamore maple, and wild cherry. Together, these species will help create a diverse and future-proof forest structure.

Life Terra extends a heartfelt thank-you to ClimatePartner for their ongoing support‚Äîand that of their clients‚Äîfor planting projects across Europe. This marked our second joint planting project in the Berlin region, and it was a great opportunity to strengthen collaboration while contributing tangibly to forest restoration.

We look forward to many more opportunities to grow climate impact together.

items.name: Zapre≈°iƒá Plants Its First ‚ÄúCro≈°njica‚Äù Urban Forest!

fields.event-name: Zapre≈°iƒá Plants Its First ‚ÄúCro≈°njica‚Äù Urban Forest!
fields.event_details:
To celebrate Zapre≈°iƒá City Day, the first urban ‚ÄúCro≈°njica‚Äù micro-forest was planted in the courtyard of Ljudevit Gaj Primary School‚Äîmarking Croatia‚Äôs second Cro≈°njica site and the first within a city.

More than 150 volunteers, including students, scouts, and company volunteers from Atlantic Grupa, joined forces to plant 196 seedlings. After planting, volunteers mulched the area with wood shavings to protect the young plants and created small gravel paths, each species labeled with Croatian and Latin names.

The initiative combines community engagement, environmental education, and biodiversity enhancement, offering children a living classroom to observe nature‚Äôs growth and processes.

According to headmaster Tomislav Cerinski, students are proud to care for the Cro≈°njica and excited to see it grow over time.

The project was supported by Atlantic Grupa, which contributed volunteers and funding for seedlings, as part of its ESG and community engagement goals, and by the City of Zapre≈°iƒá, whose deputy mayor praised the initiative and expressed hope for many more Cro≈°njicas in the future.

Check out the video!: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X5NjGauMy4Q

items.name: The Green Train - Riding the Night, Planting the Future

fields.event-name: The Green Train - Riding the Night, Planting the Future
fields.event_details:
The Green Train represents a groundbreaking collaboration between sustainable transport, ecological restoration, and cultural engagement.

The Green Train brings together the Finnish artist Nina Backman‚Äôs Silence Project, and the enviroment Project A Million Trees to Finland together with European Sleeper, and a network of environmental partners to create a unique art-driven journey across borders

From 21‚Äì23 October, the European Sleeper train between Berlin and Amsterdam becomes a moving platform for reflection, dialogue, and collaboration. Along the way, travellers can take part in tree planting, bring home seedlings from the Tree Cabin, and join seminars and workshops on sustainability and culture.

The Green Train is more than a journey. It‚Äôs the start of a shared movement to create climate-conscious routes that connect landscapes, communities, and cultures across Europe.

Partners of The Green Train:

- The Silence Project - https://www.silenceproject.fi/silence-project.html

- A Million Trees To Finland - https://miljoonanpuuntalkoot.com

- European sleeper - https://www.europeansleeper.eu/

- Artpress Ute Weingarten - https://www.artpress-uteweingarten.de/

- Finnish Environment Institute - https://www.syke.fi/en

- Finnland-Institut - https://finnland-institut.de/en/

- Finnish Institute Benelux - https://finncult.be

- Thinking Forest Foundation - https://thinkingforestfoundation.org

- Mediamatic - https://www.mediamatic.net/en

- Landgoed Welna - https://landgoedwelna.nl

- Life Terra Foundation - https://www.lifeterra.eu/en
fields.subscription_instructions: Jump on the European Sleeper train from 21‚Äì23 October between Berlin and Amsterdam.

items.name: Plant Roots in the Future!

fields.event-name: Plant Roots in the Future!
fields.event_details:
On November 8, 2025, we raised awareness about climate change and sustainability with a large-scale afforestation event in Ereƒüli, Turkey. Despite the expected winter weather, the event took place on warmer and sunnier days than expected.

This meaningful event was successfully realized thanks to the full support and extensive logistical support of the local municipality. The municipality not only provided land and pine saplings for planting but also provided bus transportation to the site for participants.

The event was well-attended and encompassed a wide range of participants:

Students from various educational levels, from kindergarten to university, took active roles.

Teachers, parents, municipal staff, and members of the public all worked together.

This collaborative effort ensured that the event went beyond simply planting trees; it became a powerful example of community cooperation and solidarity.

Before the saplings were planted, a comprehensive information and awareness session was held for the students. A circle was formed, and the students discussed climate change, the vital importance of trees to the ecosystem, and the reasons for selecting suitable pine saplings for the region in depth. This preliminary preparation enabled the young people to learn about climate action.

Participants then divided into teams of two or three and began planting with the shovels and saplings provided. The process involved planting 1,000 saplings, which was both fun and educational for children and volunteers. Parents also participated in the experience by supporting their children.

At the culmination of the event, meticulous work was done to ensure each sapling was firmly planted in the soil. The team spirit displayed during this process reinforced the children's sense of responsibility towards nature and taught them the value of supporting each other in a practical way.

After the planting was completed, the group gathered at the event site to assess the environmental and social impacts of the planting and to discuss the saplings' future. Each planted pine sapling became not only a tree but also a living symbol of memory, hope, and responsibility towards future generations.

The overwhelmingly positive feedback from parents and other schools reaffirmed the positive impact of such environmentally friendly activities on children's development and their contribution to social cohesion.
fields.subscription_instructions: Participants will be able to register through our online form shared on the school and municipality's social media channels, or they will be able to come to the designated tree planting area on the day of the event.

fields.event-name: Forest Planting at Ponce de Le√≥n
fields.event_details:
Last Friday, 28th, CEIP Ponce de Le√≥n carried out a pine and oak tree planting initiative in which all the school's pupils, the Campi√±a Viva Association, Torredonjimieno Town Council and all the families who wanted to join us took part. In total, more than 200 people participated and 120 trees were planted.

It was a day of togetherness in which values towards the environment and sustainability were promoted among all participants.

We hope to continue participating in many more initiatives like these.

items.name: Expanding our forest near Warsaw with Mapletree

fields.event-name: Expanding our forest near Warsaw with Mapletree
fields.event_details:
During a chilly but sunny autumn afternoon, volunteers from our partner Mapletree helped to plant 1000 trees in the area of Nowy Dw√≥r Mazowiecki, close to Warsaw. This initiative is part of our broader support for reforestation in the area, marking the third year that we have planted trees in the riparian zone next to the Narew river together with our local partner Aeris Futuro.

These new forests will boost biodiversity in this essential ecosystem for many species of birds and insects. We are therefore very grateful for the ongoing support of our partner Mapletree and for Aeris Futuro managing and facilitating this project!

items.name: Family Planting in Las Rozas 2025

fields.event-name: Family Planting in Las Rozas 2025
fields.event_details:
The new planting season started with the fifth edition of the Las Rozas Family Planting! This event manages to gather thousands of people year after year in this municipality in the outskirts of Madrid, in where families can enjoy a day of planting, sustainability workshops for children and even live music and dance!

This year we managed to plant 1630 plants of 14 different native species in a degraded slagheap, helping to restore not only biodiversity within the municipality, but also landscape values and soil fixation. Initiatives like this are key to promote healthier and greener urban areas, creating areas with higher natural and aesthetic values.

A special thanks to the Jovenes Voluntarios de Las Rozas, who, again, attended Life Terra's workshop on planting and assisted the numerous families that attended. Of course, a very special thanks to Las Rozas Municipality and its mayor, Jose de la Uz, for promoting these initiatives in where the local commuity can engage in environmental education and ecological restoration.

We're already looking forward to nex years edition!
fields.subscription_instructions: No registration is required. Just be in the designate area on the date and time of the activity (approx 12:00)

items.name: Alto Mijares Ecorestoration

fields.event-name: Alto Mijares Ecorestoration
fields.event_details:
It was a very cold and windy day in Fuente La Reina, so unfortunately we had quite a few last-minute cancellations. Nonetheless, the 25 people who participated did a fantastic job, supervised by David and Alicia, our local foresteers.

There were also 3 dogs running around and one small boy helping his Mom and Dad, so it was an authentic community event. Afterwards we enjoyed a short concert of M√∫sica Pel Clima, and a tasty lunch in the bar of Fuente La Reina

items.name: Planting in Boboc Military Base

fields.event_details: We are planting 8.000 saplings of Robinia Pseudoacacia at the Air Force Application School "Aurel Vlaicu" in Boboc, BuzƒÉu County, with the help of 400 volunteers, adults and children from our partners from AGRII, Allianz Tiriac Asigurari, Arval, Bunge, CGS, Corteva, Electrolux, Filbo (Omro) and Unilever.

items.name: EY reforestation event at Staelduinse Bos

fields.event-name: EY reforestation event at Staelduinse Bos
fields.event_details: All participants arrived on time and very motivated. Many already had experience with tree planting events, and we could directly sense it. While the lead-up to the event wasn't auspicious, combining heavy rain and wind, the dramatic weather suddenly stopped when the volunteers started arriving, and we even saw some sun shine. The forester gave a compelling presentation of the planting site and the reasons for the reforestation, which seemed to motivate the participants even more! Without further ado, they all grabbed spades and trees, and engaged in their endeavors energetically. While allowing themselves to have a chat and to joke around, everyone planted seriously and efficiently. They were so quick that the foresters had to fetch more seedlings to be planted. Both the foresters' and our expectations were exceeded, as more than 700 trees were planted within 2 hours of work. They day ended rapidly as the sun went down, and everyone left the planting site satisfied with all the good work accomplished!

items.name: Growing forest El Castillo

fields.event-name: Growing forest El Castillo
fields.event_details:
Each class will plant its own tree, a tree that, like our students, will grow, evolve, and develop over time. It is a symbolic and educational activity that allows us to connect planting a tree with the profound meaning of Universal Children's Day: to remember that, just as a tree needs care, attention, and a safe environment to grow, every child needs us to respect and defend their rights in order to develop fully. We will hold two plantings: one in the morning with primary and secondary school students, accompanied by families and teachers. We will repeat the activity in the afternoon for all secondary school students, also accompanied by teachers.

9:15 - 10h Reflection activity

10h Planting activity (primary and bacc students, families and teachers)

15.10h Reflection activity for 4th ESO students, and planting activity for 3rd ESO students

16.10h Reflection activity for 3rd ESO students, and planting activity for 4th ESO students

items.name: Pflanztag mit Adyen Berlin, Life Terra & aufBuchen e. V.

fields.event-name: Pflanztag mit Adyen Berlin, Life Terra & aufBuchen e. V.
fields.event_details:
This November, under a clear blue sky and bright winter sunshine, the volunteers from Adyen Berlin joined Life Terra and aufbuchen e.V. for a day at the ‚ÄúRieselfelder‚Äù, i.e. former sewage irrigation fields around Bernau bei Berlin. The project is about transforming the landscape into a recreational forest.

The area, once used for filtering wastewater, now face challenges such as dry soils, lowered groundwater levels, soil pollutants, and limited vegetation. Our planting efforts contribute to ecological restoration, water balance improvement, pollutant binding, climate adaptation, biodiversity enhancement, habitat conservation, and landscape quality for both nature and people.

Armed with spades, we dug generous holes, each just the diameter of a spade, and planted five young trees of three different species in a group per hole - an approach that encourages competitive growth, mirroring the dynamics of how forests regenerate on their own. Each tree was fitted with an individual protector, ensuring optimal conditions for its development.

This marked Adyen Berlin‚Äôs fourth planting day with Life Terra, following earlier spring events in the past years. Germany kicked off Adyen‚Äôs planting commitments 25/26 with Life Terra, with other offices set to follow in spring 2026.

items.name: Politie Noord-Holland tree planting event at Camping Rorik

fields.event-name: Politie Noord-Holland tree planting event at Camping Rorik
fields.event_details: Politie Noord-Holland will be joining us for a forestry planting event. The planting will happen in 2 phases, with a first group planting about 500 trees in the morning, and a second group planting in the afternoon. Camping Rorik is a prime estate for tree planting event half an hour away from Amsterdam, and the estimation are that more than 2500 trees could be planted there, so it could, in theory, host multiple events. More to come.

items.name: Planting a new forests near Iasi with ABN AMRO Clearing

fields.event-name: Planting a new forests near Iasi with ABN AMRO Clearing
fields.event_details:
During our first tree planting event with ABN AMRO Clearing in Romania, volunteers helped to plant 1500 trees in the area of Podu Iloaiei, close to Ia»ôi. In a collaboration with Land Life Company and our local partner Plantam Fapte Bune, we created a new climate resilient forest. Despite the weather being chilly, the participants went to work enthusiastically. It was especially great to see that some volunteers brought their children as well, to plant a forest that they will hopefully see flourish in decades to come!

We also want to highlight our partner Plantam Fapte Bune, who have managed and facilitated this event. We have worked with this wonderful organisation in Romania now for multiple years and we are very impressed by the community based reforestation projects they have been able to set up in the area.

fields.event-name: Common Grounds - Plantat√≥n en Frox√°n
fields.event_details: Through collaboration between artists, researchers, and local communities, Common Grounds addresses ecological, democratic, and urban challenges from a creative and interdisciplinary perspective. The project teams and artists will be converging in Frox√°n this day to join the Plantat√≥n of the Laboratorio Ecosocial do Barbanza.

items.name: Colegio Quercus "patrulla verde"

fields.event-name: Colegio Quercus "patrulla verde"
fields.event_details:
Vamos a plantar un conjunto de plantas arom√°ticas y √°rboles para crear un mariposario en una zona determinada de nuestro colegio. Este mariposario los alumnos de 6¬∫ que pertenecen a la patrulla verde lo han llamado "el quercusario".

El muro est√°n decor√°ndolo los alumnos de secundaria con un mural dise√±ado por ellos mismos.

El proyecto se enmarca en las iniciativas del programa Ecoescuela, que promueve la educaci√≥n ambiental y la sostenibilidad entre nuestro alumnado.

Las mariposas desempe√±an un papel fundamental en los ecosistemas naturales como agentes polinizadores y son, adem√°s, aliadas esenciales de nuestro huerto escolar. Con este peque√±o oasis queremos ofrecerles un lugar bonito y natural donde puedan venir, descansar y dejarse observar. As√≠ podremos aprender m√°s sobre ellas y disfrutar de su belleza en nuestro colegio.

items.name: NVIDIA Tree Planting Day 2025 near Munich

fields.event-name: NVIDIA Tree Planting Day 2025 near Munich
fields.event_details:
This was our second successful annual tree planting day with NVIDIA not far from their Munich office! NVIDIA supported the forest restoration financially and moreover through the engaged participation of employees who volunteered for a day of unfamiliar but rewarding physical labour in the forest. It was a fantastic opportunity for NVIDIANs to contribute, to enjoy a day outdoors, and to connect amongst each other as well as with nature and a bigger purpose. One achievement was planting more biodiverse species to complement the weakened spruce dominant stands, and the other was installing the much-needed protectors around these 400 young trees.

Thank you to NVIDIA for organising the volunteering days and keeping their commitment to strengthening the local forests!

fields.event_details: Our School working with an ONG oganitation (ARBA Colmenar) will plant and look after those trees with the kids and family supervision.

items.name: Avenue of Freedom 2025

fields.event-name: Avenue of Freedom 2025
fields.event_details:
Displacement, Loss, and Resilience: The Story of the Drahan Highlands

Clear out the house, remove all furniture and personal belongings, sweep the floors, wash them, and hand over the key to the nearest gendarmerie station. Leave behind your home, your farmland, and often, have nowhere to go.

This was the fate of more than 18,500 people from the Drahansk√° Highlands, where, between 1942 and 1945, the Wehrmacht established a military training ground. Had Germany won the war, the original inhabitants would have been permanently replaced by German settlers.

The residents of 33 villages were forcibly displaced, and after the war, many had nowhere to return‚Äîtheir homes lay in ruins. It took years of relentless determination and collective effort before life could be restored in their villages.

On the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the end of the war, we have joined forces with the municipality of Bous√≠n to plant this year‚Äôs Alley of Freedom right here. Trees and the people of this land share a common spirit‚Äîstrength, resilience, and the ability to take root once again, even in the face of adversity.

items.name: Bollebos plantevent

fields.event-name: Bollebos plantevent
fields.event_details:
Het volledige programma vind je op onze website.

Kom mee planten en beleef een dag vol natuur, ontmoeting en plezier! Tijdens ons jaarlijkse Plant Event zetten we duizenden jonge boompjes in de grond. Samen maken we Haspengouw groener, gezonder en mooier ‚Äì voor onszelf √©n voor de generaties na ons.

Wat mag je verwachten?

üå± Plantmomenten: pak een schop, plant je eigen boom en zie hoe jouw inzet zichtbaar groeit.

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Familie-activiteiten: speelzones, een wensboom en een buitenklasje zorgen voor plezier voor jong en oud.

ü§ù Samenhorigheid: ontmoet buurtbewoners, verenigingen en bedrijven die samen het verschil maken.

üç≤ Warme sfeer: geniet van een hapje en drankje terwijl je de natuur dichterbij voelt komen.

Waarom meedoen?

Elke boom die we samen planten, zorgt voor:

meer rust en verkoeling in de buurt,

meer biodiversiteit voor dieren en planten,

een sterker gevoel van verbondenheid en welzijn.

[English]:

You can find the full programme on our website.

Come and plant with us and enjoy a day full of nature, meeting people and fun! During our annual Plant Event, we plant thousands of young trees. Together, we make Haspengouw greener, healthier and more beautiful ‚Äì for ourselves and for future generations.

What can you expect?

üå± Planting moments: grab a spade, plant your own tree and see your efforts grow before your eyes.

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Family activities: play areas, a wishing tree and an outdoor classroom provide fun for young and old alike.

ü§ù Togetherness: meet local residents, associations and businesses who are making a difference together.

üç≤ Warm atmosphere: enjoy a snack and a drink while feeling closer to nature.

Why participate?

Every tree we plant together provides:

more peace and coolness in the neighbourhood,

more biodiversity for animals and plants,

a stronger sense of connection and well-being.

The adoption of "F√©lix Rodr√≠guez de la Fuente Park."

We received the Eco-Schools diplomas for achieving our second Green Flag.

We received the international awards from ECF4clim: First Prize for Primary Schools and Bia Grand Prize from ECF4clim - Best Intervention Award.

Finally, we will plant the trees received by ECF4CLIM. We are supported by CIEMAT and the Alcal√° de Henares City Council through the Departments of Environment and Education.

items.name: NVM tree planting campaign event at Staelduinse Bos

fields.event-name: NVM tree planting campaign event at Staelduinse Bos
fields.event_details:
The Dutch Life Terra team joined NVM Haaglanden and Stichting Greenbookings for a meaningful planting initiative in the beautiful Staelduinse Bos near Hoek van Holland. Parts of this forest are currently dominated by maple trees and at risk of ecological decline, so planting a diverse mix of species is essential to keep the woodland healthy and resilient.

NVM Haaglanden ‚Äî the regional branch of the Dutch association of real estate agents (NVM) ‚Äî has made an inspiring commitment: for every home sold in 2025, one new tree will be planted. With over 160 participating offices, the collective impact is already significant.

By September, the campaign had reached around 7,800 trees planted, with a shared goal of achieving 10,000 trees by the end of the year. During the planting day, estate agents added their own tree to the forest ‚Äî a simple but powerful act of giving back to nature.

At Life Terra, we‚Äôre proud to support this initiative.

A big thank you to NVM Haaglanden and Greenbookings for their dedication and collaboration.

On to 10,000 trees ‚Äî and beyond!

items.name: Greenbookings tree planting event at De Natuurkamer

fields.event-name: Greenbookings tree planting event at De Natuurkamer
fields.event_details:
What a fantastic way to kick off the new planting season in The Netherlands! Together with 30 enthusiastic members of Greenbookings, we planted 1,000 mixed species, native trees at the beautiful Natuurkamer in Amsterdam-West ‚Äî a lush, nature-rich spot where visitors can learn, play, and reconnect with the outdoors right in the heart of the city.

The purpose of the planting was to increase the tree cover and shade around key areas of the park, and to boost local biodiversity by planting dense areas of bushy trees.

It was a wonderful day spent planting, connecting, and enjoying this green oasis in Amsterdam. Here‚Äôs to many more moments like these and a flourishing planting season ahead!

items.name: Seedling event at Mediamatic - The Green Train

fields.event-name: Seedling event at Mediamatic - The Green Train
fields.event_details:
The Green Train represents a groundbreaking collaboration between sustainable transport, ecological restoration, and cultural engagement.

The Green Train brings together the Finnish artist Nina Backman‚Äôs Silence Project, and the enviroment Project A Million Trees to Finland together with European Sleeper, and a network of environmental partners to create a unique art-driven journey across borders

The first "seedling event" of The Green Train will take place at Mediamatic, in Biotoop Dijkspark Dijkspark 6, 1019BS Amsterdam, from 10 AM to 2 PM. There, over 400 seedlings of native tree species such as spruce, pine and birch, amongst others will be delivered to participants.

You can read more information about this event here: https://www.mediamatic.net/en/en/page/392627/the-green-train-with-european-sleeper

Partners of The Green Train:

- The Silence Project - https://www.silenceproject.fi/silence-project.html

- A Million Trees To Finland - https://miljoonanpuuntalkoot.com

- European sleeper - https://www.europeansleeper.eu/

- Artpress Ute Weingarten - https://www.artpress-uteweingarten.de/

- Finnish Environment Institute - https://www.syke.fi/en

- Finnland-Institut - https://finnland-institut.de/en/

- Finnish Institute Benelux - https://finncult.be

- Thinking Forest Foundation - https://thinkingforestfoundation.org

- Mediamatic - https://www.mediamatic.net/en

- Landgoed Welna - https://landgoedwelna.nl

- Life Terra Foundation - https://www.lifeterra.eu/en

Free registrations here! https://mediamatic.stager.co/shop/default/events/111559962

items.name: Courelas de Carrascosa e Guadalupe - Open Days

fields.host-name: Junta de Freguesia de Vila de Frades
fields.event-name: Courelas de Carrascosa e Guadalupe - Open Days
fields.event_details:
The even will take place on 22/11/2025 and 23/11/2025, the latest of which is the National Day for Autochtonous Forest.

We will celebrate this and the European Tree Planting day with a set of activities which will include not only tree planting, but also sowing, construction of swales for water retention, monitoring of night moths (on the night from 22 to 23), a bioblitz and various others, as for program to publicly deploy in the start of November.

We will seek to have participation of thelocal public administration (Junta de Freguesia de Vila de Frades) and NGO's with whom we already cooperate actively. If possible, we will seek to organize participation of local schools , the local scouts group and the Environmental Police (SEPNA), as we did in former years.
fields.subscription_instructions: Registration information will be made available at the start of November on our instagram channel: https://www.instagram.com/courelas_de_guadalupe/
